Notes.Author: researcher@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Orb discharged vertical beam upon exposure. Atmospheric disruption recorded within hours.

Notes.Author: archivist@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Event correlated with anomalous cyclone tracks following 2010 Chile earthquake. Weather attribution maintained as natural El Niño variation.

Notes.Author: admin@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Directive: all orb-related weather incidents classified Tier-1 hazard. Civilian agencies remain uninformed.

Notes.Author: researcher@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Fragment pulses synchronized with auroral activity. Glow visible in lab containment.

Notes.Author: archivist@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Pulse pattern identical to aurora anomalies logged during October 2003 geomagnetic storm.

Notes.Author: researcher@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Metallic pylons align with magnetic field lines. Generated continental-scale resonance model.

Notes.Author: archivist@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Array activation signatures coincide with 2002 Larsen B ice shelf collapse. Public cause remains 'climate change.'

Notes.Author: researcher@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Inscribed tablet unlocks glyphs only below −10°C. Inscriptions glow under cryogenic scan.

Notes.Author: archivist@aeon.org
Notes.Content: Luminescence first observed during 1958 International Geophysical Year Antarctic survey. Records expunged.
